reviewText: The game is just a series of timing/memory puzzles. Nothing more. It gets to the point of frustration replacing enjoyment. The puzzles are not difficult in a mindbending way but rather a hair pulling way in that they require exteme quickness with your mouse and memorizing the layout while being timed on a very short clock. They are all doable but it is not what I would call a thinking mans puzzle type of game. As a diehard lover of puzzle/adventure games I really did not like this game. It may appeal to others but for me it didn't hack it. Blind faith can be costly at times. luckily for me it was only 4 bucks.
voteText: 25 of 43 people (58%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: While the concept seems interesting, it appears it didn't exactly translate into the game. Very little description of the scenario leaves to much to be asked within the first 5 minutes and mini games with overly strict of constraints made the game difficult to swallow. Supposedly we will be seeing an update soon to fix the mini games, but i believe the game needs work further to be able to be a truely enjoyable experience. I'd like to come back to this game and review it further after updates but at the time, I wouldn't recommend this game.

reviewText:
Have some mixed feelings about this game but overall I can recommend it for the price.

Pros:
* Exploration and hidden boss fights
* Surprising atmosphere with little bit adventure & little bit rpg
* The joy of reaching the true ending

Cons:
* Time limit for some puzzles make you pull your hair. Seriously
* Not perfectly polished but good enough for me
* The game does not tell you what to do, again I'm perfectly fine with this

reviewText: This game is creepy, makes me think of those salad finger videos on youtube. I like the music and the artstyle. The tree has some artifacts on it but that was the only problem I saw.\n\nI do not like the puzzles but that is just me. Overall I think it's a interesting game and worth a look.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Discloser - Review key

The game offers a unique art style that reminds me of cult classics such as Salad Fingers. There are some parts of the game where I truly feel a bit terrified, especially when you can hear something approaching and you're frantically searching for a place to hide. The combat system is simple but it does what is needed for a game focused story telling.

The game offers a challenge by giving players one life to live and a short time to do certain puzzles which many casual gamers might not be able to complete. If you consider yourself a hardcore gamer and you're looking for a game that offers challenging gameplay then this game is for you.

[Pros]
- Unique art style that gives it that cutsey but horror feel to it.
- Challenging puzzles.
- Exploration and hidden boss fights.

[Cons]
- The winning chance on the slot machines could stand to be a bit more forgiving. (Perhaps increased odds with more hit points you gamble with?)
- Some of the puzzles can be a bit TOO challenging for the casual gamer (despite the update). I would recommend perhaps either offering consumable bonuses to increase the time on puzzles or an adjustable difficulty mode. Unless such a bonus exists in the slot machines. I have yet to win at those yet.

[Would I recommend this game?]
This game has a lot of potential and the developer seems to be listening very closely to the community.  I would recommend buying it because it is a pretty awesome experience - especially for $5. That's basically a steal for the quality of fun you can have with this game and at the pace the developer seems to be patching the game, any cons to the game will likely be addressed in a pretty short amount of time.
